Articles.Content:
so i recently installed parallax and I like it a lot but there is one BIG issue that make the game unplayable. So basically when I'm coming back (from any altitude) when I get to around ~2500m - ~1000m ASL my craft will sudently explode without warning and then all that's left is just this white cube. i think it might have something to do with the collision modifier

here's a video of this happening

Edited April 23, 2021 by BC_5972
I’m not overly familiar with Parallax but doesn’t it just change the surface shaders of planets? It’s unlikely to be that if so I think? Are you running any other mods?

31 minutes ago, FruitGoose said:

I’m not overly familiar with Parallax but doesn’t it just change the surface shaders of planets? It’s unlikely to be that if so I think? Are you running any other mods?

no no other mods other then b9 partswitch and its requirement (kopernicus)

Since your flight log says "crashed into cube", I would be interested in your log file, to track down this mysterious cube. Please check out this post to learn about log files, where there are located and how to upload them
Are you playing in a Steam install?  Did you ever have any mods installed?
I need your log file to be able to work out what happened

Actually I was wrong. Apparently Parallax adds ground collisions (so rovers follow the new terrain shape) and in the video, the wheels on the demo rover seem to be touching 4 of those cube things that destroyed your ship (video is on the mod thread).

Therefore your first thought may be right and for some reason parallax thinks the ground is 2k asl and the ship is in effect ‘crashing into the ground’.  Or terrorists have taken over KSC and adjusted the ILS ground height like on Die Hard 2. Either way I’d ask in the Parallax thread as seems like a bug with that (or definitely related).
